de.ralleytn.wrapper.microsoft.xinput

Class XInputVibration

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sun.jna.Structure
      • de.ralleytn.wrapper.microsoft.xinput.XInputVibration

  • public final class XInputVibration
extends com.sun.jna.Structure

    specifies motor speed levels for the vibration function of a controller.

    Remarks

    The left motor is the low-frequency rumble motor. The right motor is the high-frequency rumble motor. The two motors are not the same, and they create different vibration effects.

    Requirements

    HeaderXInput.h

    Source: Microsoft Documentation

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Ralph Niemitz/RalleYTN(ralph.niemitz@gmx.de)
    See Also:
    XInput Structures, XInput.XInputSetState(int, XInputVibration), XInputGamepad, XInput.XInputGetCapabilities(int, int, XInputCapabilities)

    • Field Detail

      • wLeftMotorSpeed

        public short wLeftMotorSpeed

        Speed of the left motor. Valid values are in the range 0 to 65535. Zero signifies no motor use; 65535 signifies 100 percent motor use.

        Source: Microsoft Documentation

        Since:
        1.0.0

      • wRightMotorSpeed

        public short wRightMotorSpeed

        Speed of the right motor. Valid values are in the range 0 to 65535. Zero signifies no motor use; 65535 signifies 100 percent motor use.

        Source: Microsoft Documentation

        Since:
        1.0.0

      • XInputVibration

        public XInputVibration()
